thread.title: Gary Barlow makes dig at Simon Cowell as he launches X Factor rival that Cowell is considering suing
thread.title_full: Gary Barlow makes dig at Simon Cowell as he launches X Factor rival that Cowell is considering suing

author: Ashleigh Rainbird
title: Gary Barlow makes dig at Simon Cowell as he launches X Factor rival that Cowell is considering suing
text:
TV Gary Barlow makes dig at Simon Cowell as he launches X Factor rival that Cowell is considering suing The former Take That star is fronting a BBC show called Let It Shine which is looking for five singers for a tribute act Share The Let It Shine panel Amber Riley, Gary Barlow, Dannii Minogue and Martin Kemp and hosts Mel Giedroyc and Graham Norton (Photo: BBC) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Take That star Gary Barlow made a thinly veiled dig at the X Factor while launching his rival show, Let It Shine. 
Simon Cowell is reportedly considering legal action against the new BBC reality series, which searches for five singers to form a Take That tribute act, who will star in a West End musical. 
The X Factor , which previously featured Gary as a judge, offers its contestants a recording contract, but several of the show’s winners get dropped after one single. 
Gary, 45, says of his new series: “This is for a job, it is not someone waving a contract. The record business is very hard now I can’t even predict what is going to be successful or not. But with this I was able to sit there and say the reason you are here today is a job. We are going to give you an opportunity to play around the UK 8 shows a week. By the end of the year I hope these will be the start of careers of years to come.” Simon Cowell is considering legal action against the BBC show 
Gary even hired former X Factor judge Dannii Minogue on the panel, and reportedly attempted to poach current X Factor judge Nicole Scherzinger. Gary's team are looking for a tribute act (Photo: BBC) 
Meanwhile, Gary has opened up to the Radio Times about his battle with depression following Take That’s split. 
“I wasn’t happy for a long period and when you know what that feels like, then I don’t care who you are, you’re going to wake up some mornings and you’re going to feel s***. You just are. Read More Gary Barlow claims X Factor judges can't hear much of the auditions - is THAT how Honey G got through? 
“You’re going to have your winter days, and I know what that feeling’s like and I hate it. I will do anything to get me from that space. I’ll go for a run. I’ll go and have an ice bath or I’ll go and watch my son’s football game. I know what I need to do to get out of it. And that means I have to keep working.” Gary admitted he was depressed following Take That split (Photo: Rex Features) 
He continues to explain that all performers battle similar demons, saying: “Because it’s an indescribable thing, waving off at Hyde Park and as far as your eye can see there’s hands waving back at you. Now that’s not normal, that isn’t.” 
He continues that it is important artists manage to handle “the balance of life”. 
Let It Shine begins on BBC1 at 7pm on Saturday, and will go head to head with ITV’s The Voice. Read More
